lead_paragraph: Bernard Robinson, a reserve with the Nets, tore the medial collateral ligament in his left knee in practice last week. Rod Thorn, the Nets’ president, said there was no timetable for his return. After being acquired from Charlotte in exchange for Jeff McInnis and cash considerations in January, Robinson, a three-year veteran swingman, played 10 games for the Nets. He has averaged 4.6 points, 2.6 rebounds and 1 assist in 128 career games.
